entry.name: selectmenu
entry.title: Selectmenu Widget
entry.desc: Duplicates and extends the functionality of a native HTML select element to overcome the limitations of the native control.

longdesc.p: Selectmenu transforms a <select> element into a themeable and customizable control. The widget acts as a proxy to the original <select>; therefore the original element's state is maintained for form submission and serialization.
Selectmenu supports <optgroup> elements and custom markup to render specific presentations like multiple lines. The <select> and its options can be disabled by adding a disabled attribute.

div.p: Note: Support for accesskey on custom elements is extremely limited in browsers. As such, if there is an accesskey attribute on the <select> element, it will not work with the custom selectmenu. If there is an accesskey attribute on any of the <option> elements, using the accesskey may cause the original element and the custom element to be out of sync. However, most browsers don't support accesskey on <option> elements.

longdesc.p: When the menu is open, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT: Move focus to the previous item.
DOWN/RIGHT: Move focus to the next item.
END/PAGE DOWN: Move focus to the last item.
HOME/PAGE UP: Move focus to the first item.
ENTER/SPACE: Select the currently focused item and close the menu.
ALT/OPTION + UP/DOWN: Toggle the visibility of the menu.

longdesc.p: When the menu is closed, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: END/PAGE DOWN: Select the last item.
HOME/PAGE UP: Select the first item.
ALT/OPTION + UP/DOWN: Toggle the visibility of the menu.

option.name: appendTo
option.desc: Which element to append the menu to. When the value is null, the parents of the <select> are checked for a class name of ui-front. If an element with the ui-front class name is found, the menu is appended to that element. Regardless of the value, if no element is found, the menu is appended to the body.

option.name: icons
option.desc:
Icons to use for the button, matching an icon defined by the jQuery UI CSS Framework.
button (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-s")

option.name: position
option.desc: Identifies the position of the menu in relation to the associated button element. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

option.name: width
option.desc: The width of the menu, in pixels. When the value is null, the width of the native select is used.

event.name: change
event.desc: Triggered when the selected item has changed. Not every select event will fire a change event.

event.name: close
event.desc: Triggered when the menu is hidden.

event.name: focus
event.desc: Triggered when an items gains focus.

event.name: open
event.desc: Triggered when the menu is opened.

event.name: select
event.desc: Triggered when a menu item is selected.

method.name: menuWidget
method.desc: Returns a jQuery object containing the menu element.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Parses the original element and re-renders the menu. Processes any <option> or <optgroup> elements that were added, removed or disabled.

method.name: widget
method.desc: Returns a jQuery object containing the button element.

desc.p: Method that controls the creation of each option in the widget's menu. The method must create a new <li> element, append it to the menu, and return it.

argument.name: ul
argument.desc: The <ul> element that the newly created <li> element must be appended to.

property.name: index
property.desc: The index of the <option> within the <select>.

property.name: optgroup
property.desc: The label for the parent optgroup, if any.

example.desc: Style the menu item background colors based on the value of their corresponding option elements.

method.name: _renderMenu
method.desc: Method that controls building the widget's menu. The method is passed an empty <ul> and an array of items based on the <option> elements in the original <select>. Creation of the individual <li> elements should be delegated to _renderItemData(), which in turn delegates to the _renderItem() extension point.

argument.name: ul
argument.desc: An empty <ul> element to use as the widget's menu.

argument.name: items
argument.desc: An array of items based on the <option> elements in the original <select>. See the _renderItem() extension point for details on the format of the item objects.

desc.p: Add a CSS class name to the odd menu items.
desc.div: Note: For simplicity, this example does not support optgroups or disabled menu items.

method.name: _resizeMenu
method.desc: Method responsible for sizing the menu before it is displayed. The menu element is available at this.menu.

example.desc: Always display the menu as 500 pixels wide.

desc.p: Method that controls the creation of the generated button content. The method must create and return a new element.

property.name: element
property.desc: A reference to the item's original <option> element.

property.name: index
property.desc: The numeric index of the item.

property.name: label
property.desc: The string to display for the item.

property.name: optgroup
property.desc: If the item is within an <optgroup>, this is set to that <optgroup>'s label.

property.name: value
property.desc: The value attribute of the item's original <option>.

example.desc: Style the button background color based on the value of the selected option.

example.html: <label for="speed">Select a speed:</label> <select name="speed" id="speed"> <option value="Slower">Slower</option> <option value="Slow">Slow</option> <option value="Medium" selected>Medium</option> <option value="Fast">Fast</option> <option value="Faster">Faster</option> </select>

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Selectmenu with optgroups
example.html: <label for="files">Select a file:</label> <select name="files" id="files"> <optgroup label="Scripts"> <option value="jquery">jQuery.js</option> <option value="jqueryui">ui.jQuery.js</option> </optgroup> <optgroup label="Other files"> <option value="somefile">Some unknown file</option> <option value="someotherfile">Some other file</option> </optgroup> </select>

example.desc: A jQuery UI Selectmenu with overflow
example.html: <label for="number">Select a number:</label> <select name="number" id="number"> <option value="1">1</option> <option value="2" selected>2</option> <option value="3">3</option> <option value="4">4</option> <option value="5">5</option> <option value="6">6</option> <option value="7">7</option> <option value="8">8</option> <option value="9">9</option> <option value="10">10</option> <option value="11">11</option> <option value="12">12</option> <option value="13">13</option> <option value="14">14</option> <option value="15">15</option> <option value="16">16</option> <option value="17">17</option> <option value="18">18</option> <option value="19">19</option> </select>
